alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued October 31 at 2:43PM MDT until November 02 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...The southern and eastern highlands of east Idaho, mainly at lower elevations in valleys oriented north-south. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Isolated damage to trees, powerlines, signs, and outbuildings is possible, along with isolated power outages. Loose outdoor objects could be blown around. Blowing dust could limit visibility to the point where highways will be temporarily closed until the phenomenon passes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing dust could severly limit visibility for drivers, especially known areas such as Interstate 84 in the Juniper and Raft River Valleys.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Secure loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds. Drivers of high profile vehicles should consider scheduling travel outside the period of expected high winds.
